info.name: Composite Image Generator
info.description: Uses background and object images to generate an object detection dataset

parameters.name: Composite Directory
parameters.help: What folder are the source composite images found in? (there should be background and object folders)

parameters.name: Remove background from raw objects (with rembg)?
parameters.help: Whether to remove the background from raw object images and add them to the composites directory. This can be quite a slow process.

parameters.name: Raw Object Directory
parameters.help: This directory should contain images of your object on a plain background, this will be removed and cropped then placed in the composites directory to be used as objects

parameters.name: Resize raw object images to match background
parameters.help: How to resize the raw object images

valid.label: Fit raw image to background width
Fit raw image to background height

parameters.name: Custom pixel widths for each label [label,width]
parameters.help: Comma-separated list of pixel widths for each label in the format [label,width]. By default any non-mentioned labels will not be resized, you can change this by passing [else,75]

parameters.name: Ignore previously resized raw objects found in composites directory
parameters.help: If you have already resized your raw objects and they are in the composites directory, you can skip resizing them again

parameters.name: Labels
parameters.help: Which objects to generate images for, as a comma-separated list. Set as 'all' to generate images for all objects

parameters.name: Number of images
parameters.help: Number of images to generate

parameters.name: Object area
parameters.help: x1,y1,x2,y2 coordinates of the valid area to place objects in the composite image, or -1 for the whole image

parameters.name: Crop objects outside the chosen area
parameters.help: Whether to crop objects that are outside the object area so that only the part of the object that is inside the area is visible

parameters.name: Maximum number of objects
parameters.help: Maximum number of objects to generate in each image

parameters.name: Allow overlap
parameters.help: Whether objects are allowed to overlap

parameters.name: Allow rotate
parameters.help: Whether to apply random rotation to objects

parameters.name: Apply motion blur?
parameters.help: Whether to apply blur to objects to simulate motion

parameters.name: Motion blur direction
parameters.help: What direction to apply blur to objects to simulate motion (-1 for random)

parameters.name: Apply fisheye lens effect
parameters.help: Whether to apply fisheye lens effect to the final images

parameters.name: Apply fisheye lens effect to all layers
parameters.help: Whether to apply fisheye lens effect to all layers or just to the objects (in case your background images are already fisheyed)

parameters.name: Fisheye lens effect strength
parameters.help: Strength of the fisheye lens effect

parameters.name: Crop to fisheye?
parameters.help: Whether to crop the image to remove black borders after applying fisheye lens effect

parameters.name: Upload to category
parameters.help: Data will be uploaded to this category in your project
